deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2081-12-16
OFFICE NOTE
Louisville Care Center
43 Riverside Circle
Changchun, LA 14176
Xanders, Ruth
MR #564-19-92-7
December 16, 2081
Ms. Xanders is a 42-year-old woman with multiple medical problems who
presents for evaluation of chronic hepatitis C. She reports having
had a blood transfusion in 2059 and has had no history of other
percutaneous exposure including intravenous drug use. She has had
normal transaminases in the past but a positive hepatitis C
antibody test. She reports no abdominal pain, nausea or vomiting,
anorexia or weight loss, no diarrhea, constipation, melena or
bright red blood per rectum. She has had no fevers, chills,
sweats, arthralgias, myalgias or skin rash, epistaxis, easy
bruising or bleeding gums and she has no insomnia or episodes of
confusion. She reports a generally good energy level with some
mild fatigue.
Past Medical History:
1. Hypertension.
2. Diabetes.
3. Chronic renal insufficiency.
4. Hyperlipidemia.
Current Medications: Humulin NPH 20 units qAM, 15 qPM, Humulin
Regular insulin 3 units qAM, 5 qPM, Lipitor 40 mg po q.h.s.,
Procrit 3,000 units sub q. bi week, Lasix 40 mg po q. day, Quinine
260 mg po q.h.s. and Hyzaar 100/25 mg po q. day as well as Naftin
prn.
Allergies: Lisinopril causes cough.
Family History: No history of liver disease or GI malignancies.
Social History: She continues to smoke but has cut back recently
and she drinks alcohol approximately once a week to once every two
weeks.
Review of systems otherwise negative for HEENT, cardiovascular,
respiratory, GI, GU, musculoskeletal or neurological systems.
On exam, she is a well-appearing woman in no acute distress. Pulse
80 and regular, blood pressure 152/76, weight 151 pounds. HEENT
she is anicteric with equal, round, reactive pupils and normal
conjunctivae. Oropharynx reveals no ulcers or icterus. Neck
reveals no lymphadenopathy or thyromegaly. Chest is clear to
auscultation and percussion. Heart reveals a regular rate and
rhythm, S1 and S2 are present without murmur, rub or gallop.
Xanders, Ruth
MR #564-19-92-7 -2- December 16, 2081
Abdomen is soft, nontender and non-distended with no
hepatosplenomegaly or masses. Extremities reveal no clubbing,
cyanosis or edema.
Most recent labs from October 22, 2081 reveal an ALT of 13, AST 19,
alkaline phosphatase 78, bilirubin 0.3, creatinine 3.1, albumin
3.6.
Impression: Ms. Xanders has a history of a positive hepatitis C
antibody with normal LFT's. Today, we will check a hepatitis C RNA
level to see if she is in fact viremic or whether she is one of the
lucky 15% of people who clear the virus but remain antibody
positive. If she does not have hepatitis C RNA in her blood, than
she requires no further workup. However, if she is RNA positive
than I would suggest a liver biopsy to assess the degree of
inflammation of fibrosis in her liver and make possible plans for
treatment with interferon/ribavirin. She is amenable to this and
we will follow-up in two weeks by phone to discuss the results of
her RNA test.
Quanterius L. Sorensen, M.D.
DD: 12/16/81
DT: 12/19/:1
DV: 12/16/81
/renteria
